name: Fairbank Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a great base with a beautiful beach and quaint town just a short stroll away. The view of the bay from our room was amazing.
reviews.title: Friendly, informal hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not realise that this hotel was only a 2 star until I was told by the owners. It may be small but it is the best 2 star we have stayed in! The owners couldn't do enough to make our stay pleasant. The hotel is clean and bright and for its class, I would highly recommend it for both families and couples.
reviews.title: Our little Hidden Gem revisited!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A wonderful welcome from Elaine and Paul on our arrival. We had been looking forward to staying at the Farbank Hotel once again. We were not disappointed, lovely clean fresh bedroom with stunning views and amazing breakfasts. To top it all beautiful weather! Highly recommend for short or long stays a wonderful place to relax and enjoy their beautiful garden and the lovely family atmospher. The icing on the cake for any holiday!! Fairbank Hotel - Crantock is a MUST to visit and take away some happy memories of your holiday in this Hidden Gem!
reviews.title: Amazing
Excellent service and fantastic views!
reviews.text: We stayed for four nights at beginning of June. Lovely room, breathtaking views of sea, welcoming and caring hosts. Elaine and Paul were so kind , nothing was any trouble.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we ever get back to Cornwall then this would be our place to stay.
reviews.title: How Nice

reviews.text: What a find! the hotel was clean, comfortable and welcoming, not to mention views to die for -especially the sunsets.
reviews.title: lovely spring break!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is ideal for exploring southern Cornwall and we had some great days out and about, then back for delicious evening meals. We contemplated going elsewhere for evening meals but the menu was so good why would we bother?
reviews.title: Fabulous break

reviews.text: Breakfast excellent too, in fact I can't find a bad thing to write!! Thank you to Elaine and Paul.
reviews.title: Recommendation that proved Excellent

reviews.text: This was the second time at the hotel and like the first we found it very comfortable and clean. Paul and Elaine made us feel very welcome. The weather behaved itself and the view from our room was fab as it was from the deck and dining room. We look forward to returning in the future.
reviews.title: A lovely Hotel

reviews.text: We were only able to stay for one night but wished it could have been longer. Comfortable, clean, bright and airy with fabulous views and a good breakfast with friendly and helpful hosts. within walking distance of the village, the beach and also the renowned Bowgie pub it proved the perfect location.
reviews.title: Our Stay

reviews.text: We have just had 4 fabulous days at Fairbank.
reviews.title: Little Gem by the sea!!

reviews.text: We were there for our daughters wedding and Elaine and Paul were the perfect hosts, nothing was to much trouble.
reviews.title: Very nice and friendly atmosphere

reviews.text: Elaine and Paul have created a cosy delightful place to stay.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was comfortable and spacious, spotlessly clean, and we were able to sit up in bed and watch the sea.
reviews.title: Fabulous Fairbank

reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent, fresh local produce, cooked to your order and good choices.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at this lovely, family run hotel. The welcome was so friendly and we loved the gorgeous view of Crantock Bay from our bedroom. Breakfast was very good and we foun the hotel facilities, setting etc excellent. We would definitely stay here again. Our only suggestion for improvement, and this is a totally personal view, would be to serve cafetieres of coffee at breakfast instead of filter coffee. We are coffee fiends and love fresh coffee but having said that our coffee cups were always being topped up. Thank you to Paul and Elaine for making our stay such a pleasant one.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.text: A 3 night stay recently with our 12 year old son was just perfect - ticking all of our boxes and more. My husband has been fortunate enough to experience many so called 5 Star Hotel's all around the world and firmly believes that owners/management/staff cultivate the atmosphere and make or break any hotel - that's why "Fairbank" is such a welcoming place to stay. We were made to feel at home right from the moment our reservation was made over the phone and this continued throughout our visit. The nearby beach is obviously a natural treasure and the evening meal not to be missed - Rick Stein eat your heart out!
reviews.title: The X Factor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lorna Ingham - Mike and George
reviews.title: Brilliant Weekend

reviews.text: We celebrated my sisters birthday (2 x couples) at this hotel weekend of 28/6/13. We use to visit Crantock in Cornwall as a family and had some lovely memories as children enjoying our summer holidays there. We choose the Fairbank Hotel due to it's location of Crantock village and reviews. We all enjoyed the lovely comfortable bedrooms and good breakfast we received as well as the great hospitality that Paul and Elaine greeted us with. Nothing was any trouble to them we really felt at ease and enjoyed our short stay there. We want to book again next year (August 2014) and bring our other sister as a special birthday surprise. Definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to visiting it again next year. Stuart,Sally,Gavin & Della
reviews.title: Brilliant. Travelling with young kids & need adjoining room this is your place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have two young children & looking for adjoining hotel rooms. We had a lovely double room with a corridor that led to ensuite bathroom with a bath and another room with bunkbeds. It was perfect! Rooms are very clean & functional, breakfasts were great and owners couldn't have been more helpful. Hotel is set in a lovely location. The owners are very children friendly & were happy to accommodate breakfast requests etc. The nearby Crantock beach is stunning. This is within walking distance as is a lovey pub and costal walk. This is a stunning part of Cornwall and this is the perfect place to stay. Delightful holiday!
reviews.title: Far exceeded our expectations.

description: Fairbank Hotel is a family run small hotel perfectly located in a tranquil, traditional Cornish country village by the sea.
